channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA

item.title: Report X-2023101031
item.description:
Report X-2023101031

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-09
  • City: CHINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: We received a call over the radio of a hazmat spill. When i arrived a the site of the spill I covered the spill with absorbent and placed the package in a tote lined with absorbent pads. I then placed the package under the vent to let it dry. DescribePack: There is a white fiberboard box with with a brown fiberboard box on the inside that contained the bottles of alcohol. There was nothing wrong with the packaging; the only problem was that the cap to one of the bottles had come loose, which caused the spill. After tightening the cap nothing more was leaking out. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent material was placed around the spill to contain the leak, and the package was placed in a tote with absorbent pads.

item.title: Report X-2023101029
item.description:
Report X-2023101029

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-11
  • City: CITY OF INDUSTRY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called over and upon arrival 2 hazmat's were found leaked onto on the floor from another package. The hazmat's were placed in a clear hazardous materials bag and into a red hazardous bin. DescribePack: Package was found wet from all around but mostly from the bottom and side flaps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent sheets were used to clean up the leakage. Package was placed in a clear hazardous waste bag and into a red hazardous bin which was layered with absorbent.

item.title: Report X-2023101018
item.description:
Report X-2023101018

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-11
  • City: SAN DIEGO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS PULLED FROM THE UNLOAD AND IMMEDIATELY PLACED INTO A LINED TOTE, AND STAGED FOR QA TO PROCESS. DescribePack: INSIDE THE PACKAGE THERE WERE 4 TINS OF THE PAINT ADDITIVE, ONE OF THEM THE TOP POPPED OFF AND THE CONTENTS OF THAT TIN EMPTIED OUT INTO THE CONTAINER CAUSING THE DAMAGE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED INTO A LINED AND THE SPILLAGE CLEANED WITH ABSORBANT PADS

item.title: Report X-2023101016
item.description:
Report X-2023101016

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was mishandled. Which then led to the steel drum to be dented and spill. It was then put in a hazmat bag and tote. DescribePack: The package was found dented which caused a spill. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was then put in a hazmat bag and tote to prevent leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023101014
item.description:
Report X-2023101014

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-11
  • City: PALMDALE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found outside on the rollers, and the box looked damp as if it was leaking or leaked on. Further inspection of the contents found one of the containers was lighter than the rest, suggesting a leakage of contents. It was then brought to the QA cage for processing. DescribePack: There is a large dent in the side of the container that was found to be lighter than the rest. The dent was located against the side of the box, which suggests it may have been dropped or pressed against something to cause a leakage out of the cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Separated from the other packages and brought to the QA cage. Most of the liquid was soaked up by the box.

item.title: Report X-2023101012
item.description:
Report X-2023101012

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-10
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: UNPROCESSED HAZMAT PACKAGE CAME FROM LOADSIDE LEAKING CAUSTIC SUBSTANCE. DescribePack: PLASTIC DRUM LEAKED FROM LID DESPITE BEING TIGHT. DRUM DEFECT, GASKET NO IN PLACED IN LID. SPILL VERY MINOR. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL COLLECTED WITH PHNINE AND SMALL BROOM. PACKAGE PLACE IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2023100999
item.description:
Report X-2023100999

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-10
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package retrieve from trailer after the unloader reported a leaking hazmat. Box was wet on one of the corner of the bottom of the box. Inside, another box was found and inside that are 4 qty of 1 Gallon plastic containers of MC-3 Cleaner Concentrate,. DescribePack: All 4 bottles have their cap popped up. Two of the bottle have a deep dent on the body and residue of the contents are seen from the lip of the mouth down to the body of the bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Immediately placed in a plastic lined container and wiped down any spills in the trailer.

item.title: Report X-2023100994
item.description:
Report X-2023100994

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-10
  • City: CITY OF INDUSTRY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023100994 SequenceEvent: Package was found wet on the bottom on the ground of the load side. DescribePack: The 4 bottles had loose caps which caused them to slowly leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the package was quick put into a hazmat bag and taken to the hazmat cage. 2. X-2023100996 SequenceEvent: Package was found on the ground of the load side wet from the bottom. DescribePack: The 4 bottles of Spor-Klenz Concentrate were found with loose caps which cause the spillage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately put into a hazmat bag and taken to the hazmat cage. 3. X-2023100997 SequenceEvent: package was found on the ground of the load side with an internal leakage. DescribePack: the 4 bottles of spor-klenz concentrate were found with loose caps which caused them to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the package was immediately put into a hazmat bag and taken to the hazmat cage. 4. X-2023101035 SequenceEvent: Package was called out for being a leaking hazmat. QA responded to call and removed the hazmat properly. Found on the floor in the load side leaking internally. DescribePack: The bottles had loose caps which caused the internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was immediately cleaned up and brought to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023100805
item.description:
Report X-2023100805

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-13
  • City: ANAHEIM
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A LEAKER WAS CALLED OUT ON THE SORT AISLE. THE RESPONDER RESPONDED TO THE PACKAGE AND FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE. RESPONDER DISCOVERED THE CONTAINER WAS MADE OF GLASS AND WAS DESTROYED. THE REST OF THE CONTAINERS WERE CONTAMINATED AND WERE PROCESSED IN THE DMP. THE DECISION TREE AND PROPER RESPONSE SHEET WERE USED IN THIS PROCESS.

item.title: Report X-2023100906
item.description:
Report X-2023100906

  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The Hazmat package was damaged during inbound sort. The outer layer of the package was found wet with white paint. QA was called and proper handling was done to get the package over to the Hazmat cage to be processed. Two of the cans of paint were leaking potentially because of a dent on the side of the cans. DescribePack: The lids on the cans of paint were a bit open. which was caused by a dent found on the cans. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The release of the contents was contained by the package box until it made it to inspection.

item.title: Report X-2023100844
item.description:

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found by QA during the preload sort and declared damaged. Put inside hazmat liner and red tote to stop spilling. MSDS report obtained by shipper. SCMS was processed. Then taken to the hazmat processing cage and put inside a yellow bin. Total duration one hour. DescribePack: Package was punctured contents spilles DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately taken by QA. It was put inside a lined hazmat tote and processed accordingly.

  • Description: A fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release at the OAKH facility. The fiberboard box contained four 1 gallon plastic containers separated with fiberboard dividers. The caps on two pf the plastic containers had come off causing a spill inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and shipper was contacted for an amended declaration for movement.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-04
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023100682 SequenceEvent: Package was torn on one side, and around that tear, discoloration is significantly obvious. Inside were 4 quantities of 1 qt Steris Spor-Klenz Concentrate, each inside a plastic bag. Inside that plastic bag, liquid can be seen out of the bottle evident of a leakage on all them DescribePack: Cap is loose about a quarter of a turn. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package removed from the trailer, placed in a plastic lined container and wiped down any spills. 2. X-2023100912 SequenceEvent: Shipment exterior packaging was wet on one corner on its underside and removed from the sort stream. It was put into a plastic lined container for inspection. DescribePack: One of the four bottles had a finger loose cap on it. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Excess liquid was soaked up using neutral absorbent materials, while the rest of the shipment was placed into a plastic lined container.

item.title: Report X-2023100369
item.description:
Report X-2023100369

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-14T18:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-04
  • City: COSTA MESA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 10/04/2023 at approximatelty 1207, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 475551 at the station location in Costa Mesa, reporting a non-hazardous spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box, containing a Throttle Body air intake cleaner at 12 ounces, Prestone power steering fluid at 32 ounces, Purple power cleaner and degreaser trigger spray at 40 ounces, and Purple Power cleaner and degreaser liquid at 1 gallon, which leaked partially. Further investigation revealed that the Throttle Body air intake cleaner is an aerosol container that was being shipped under the Limited quantiy exception under FedEx Extra Hours program. The shipment is being held for further disposition instructions.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the Inbound sort the package was damaged while loading into a can. QA was called to pick up the mess and clean up any spill corresponding to the contents. All clean up materials and package contents were brought to the hazmat cage to be inspected and processed. DescribePack: While the package was being loaded the lid on the cans of paint came loose letting the paint inside get onto the floor. The lid came loose due to an over look on package handling.   • Description: Tank car GBRX 702143 was reported with product down both sides of the tank car. I responded and found 2/8-man way swing bolts less than tool tight, I secured the tank car properly. The tank car was decontaminated prior to continuing in transportaion.
